text: [Music]
these people have chosen these tribes
these communities represent for me the
world's last most originally authentic
beautiful people in all their glory
my name is Jimmy Nelson I work as a
photographer and this book is a project
of mine called before they pass away
we're attracted to beautiful things
beautiful places beautiful people are
beautiful self and these people in all
their glory haven't been given that that
time haven't been given that attention
haven't been given that sort of
iconography but I really believe these
people have a fantastic authentic beauty
something that we really have lost
[Music]
the picture showing me standing up to my
knees and a flowing river behind my old
4x5 technical camera with this hooli
warrior looking over me from behind is a
particularly favorite picture by slowing
yourself down by taking this old camera
which is made of bits some of which are
50 years old by limiting myself to 100
images you become desperately focused
and the end result of the picture is
these hooli warriors standing underneath
this magnificent waterfall
the Kazakhs I've photographed other
ethnic Kazakhs living in the Altai
mountains above by an ugly in
northwestern Mongolia their
hollywood-esque you cannot believe that
these people really look the way they do
you cannot believe that the environment
that they live in they hunt in they
riding is for real these some brutal men
they're beautiful they're tall they're
elegant they could very easily be women
and often I show these specially at Wow
those ladies look great they look
stunning I said they're not women look
closely they're men they can literally
kill Lions with their bare hands
and far far north that eastern Siberia
there is this group called the Chukchi
and there's only about 60 to 80 of them
actually left living in the tundra -
it's like arriving in shangri-la and the
actual fact was only two younger tins on
the other side of the hill there they
are on the smoke coming out of the tent
and it was the most blissful feeling of
we found them we found them in a in an
area larger than France we found 30 of
the last 80 people
Tibet as it was is I have to be very
carefully a glorious country and culture
but there's so little of its left due to
the politics and history of the more
recent years but there is one part and
that is this the valley of Mustang and
it's this tiny tiny Kingdom that was
opened only opened about ten years ago
it really is pure Tibetan culture in it
in its finest but what's a disaster to
be honest is that the authorities have
got a license to build a highway from
China all the way down through Nepal
into India so these images I made I dare
to say some maybe some of the very last
images of this authentic culture and of
Tibetan culture in general in its purest
form
